profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-09-15 16:15:36 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Microfilmed materials must be consulted on microfilm. Contact Reference Services for more information.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: 88 slides: unmicrofilmed; use requires an appointment.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Resumes; 4 excerpts from journals; excerpts from the diaries of Ryder's wife, Cornelia (Meta) Breckenfeld, 1921-1922, and 1951; correspondence, 1909-1955, primarily between Ryder and his wife, but also including 3 letters from Hans Hofmann, 1931 and 1960, and Vaclav Vytlacil, 1960; and photographs and 88 slides, 1921-1959, of Ryder, his family, house, works of art, and his wedding in Paris, 1921. Also included is an introduction to Monica Haley's proposed book on Ryder.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel 3698 available at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Painter, educator, etcher, writer; Berkeley, Calif. Taught at University of California at Berkeley with Hans Hofmann.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated 1985 by Monica Haley, wife of painter John Haley, a colleague of Ryder's at the University of California, Berkeley. Monica used the papers in preparation for a book (never published) on Ryder.
